alert.note: Alert for Pondera (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 20 at 1:39PM MDT until further notice by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of north central Montana, including the following counties, Glacier and Pondera. * WHEN...Until 900 PM MDT Monday. * IMPACTS...Rises in small streams, creeks and normally dry arroyos. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 136 PM MDT, Trained weather spotters reported heavy rain in the advisory area. This will cause small stream flooding. Rainfall amounts of 2 to 3 inches have been reported in southern Glacier County through 1 PM today. - Some creeks that could experience flooding include...Badger Creek and Cut Bank Creek. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
